boardgame.name: Los Sitios de Zaragoza
boardgame.description:
This strategy game from los sitios was published it in 1990 by the now defunct Ya newspaper.

The French player must destroy 2/3 of the pieces of the Spanish player or starve the defenders of Zaragoza.
The latter is achieved by keeping the city with its defenders completely under siege for five consecutive turns.
The Spanish win if they avoid the French player to win.

The city is completely besieged by the French when its counters completely surround the perimeter with their squares of influence for a full turn.

The game is played in 16 turns.

A turn consists of alternate movement and combat of the two sides.
The French player begins.

boardgame.name: オフトゥンからの脱出: 拡張01 猫のいる生活 (Ofutun kara no Dasshutsu: Exp 01 Neko no iru Seikatsu)
boardgame.description:
オフトゥンからの脱出: 拡張01 猫のいる生活 (Ofutun kara no Dasshutsu: Exp 01 Neko no iru Seikatsu) is the first expansion set for オフトゥンからの脱出 (Ofutun kara no Dasshutsu). This expansion (Life With A Cat) adds 20 new lesson cards and extends the round to 8 rounds instead of 4.

The students have passed their exams and enter a new year of school. Things are going okay, but the midterm exam is looming. And now, a new friend enters their life...

When the players begin the game, they use the sides of the futon cards without a cat, and then flip it when they acquire their first cat. The more cats they have, the more points they can score in the game.
user summary
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: オフトゥンからの脱出 (Ofutun kara no Dasshutsu)

boardgame.name: Bleach CYOA
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the world of Bleach, in this world spirits can access great power by channeling their energy.

boardgame.name: Razzle Dazzle Jumpchain AKA the Great Jumpini
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The last thing you remember was that your ten years were up, you waited for it to end, a sensation of passing and now, there's a bloody saw in your hands, the lights are shining in your face, thousands of faces staring at you raptly.

But before you can open your mouth in explanation they clap and cheer, as your bisected victim waves happily. Great Houdini's ghost, you're a magician Harry!

boardgame.name: The Yōkai Compendium
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Our world is shrouded by a veil. A veil that protects us from the wickedness of the unknown and the horrors of the incomprehensible. Devils and gods, demons and tricksters, the holy and the unholy, they are everywhere around us, unseen by mortals. But the veil grows thinner and the nights grow darker. They walk among us and away from us. They inhabit mountains and islands, bridges and sewers. They are inside our houses and our temples, above us in the sky and below us within the oceans.

They are the yōkai.

boardgame.name: Liquid Squid
boardgame.description:
In 2088 only monolithic cities of trans-humanistic worship protrude from the crust of the earth. Between these cities lies The Expanse, where all opposed were banished. The first to stabilize an economy was Neo Tokyo. The 3 foundational levels that stabilized the economy are as follows:

THE UNDERBELLY
The Underbelly is at street level and is home to the augmentation junkies looking to merge with machines as much and as fast as possible. This is a wild jungle with extremes in morals and values. The Underbelly is a powerful economy completely driven by tech advances.

THE PEN
The Pen, home to the sheeple. The Pen is completely self contained ecosystem above the Underbelly. It is a stable economy but possesses a docile culture which needs protection provided by corporate security called "The Regulators". Now that The Pen faces a new threat from the villains henchmen, their fear needs to be managed because if the The Pen falls, so does the city.

THE QUANTUM
Above it all sits The Quantum, the home of the Corporate Elite. Completely sealed off and secured, these are the lever pullers. Their key to success was helping to facilitate a social contract with the citizens and their representatives. This unwritten understanding is what made Neo Tokyo possible and has yet to be displayed, defined or quantified.

When word got around about the quality of Aug's/Mods and the success rate, many, including Natalia Burtolla (an accomplished hacker known as Liquid Squid) rushed to Neo Tokyo. Born without legs, she came for the best money could buy. She quickly fell in love with the city and the feeling was mutual. She finally feels at home and will do anything to protect Neo Tokyo.

With great decadents comes greater corruption and the stench of that sludge attracts the greatest of villains.

When the villains henchmen hit the streets many were caught off guard. Liquid Squid was well aware and prepared for this threat. To The Underbelly, this was only a matter of time.

OBJECTIVE
A Super Villain is hell bent on terrorizing Neo Tokyo into his control. If he takes out 3 Landmarks he gains the levers of power over the entire city. When the 3rd Landmark has been targeted for attack the Super Villain himself and his elite army descend to make sure the job gets done right. Try to foil the attacks on Landmarks until you can assemble an army of allies powerful enough to defeat him and end the chaos.

DEFEND NEO TOKYO
Neo Tokyo is rife with the Villains Henchmen and natural enemy factions that will destroy anyone and anything in their path. You must protect the citizens from these threats. At the same time you must try to foil attacks on Landmarks until you are prepared to face the Super Villain.

BUILD AN ARMY
Build rep with powerful city influencers by completing missions, assemble your army of allies and temper public fear.

END THE CHAOS
When the third Landmark is triggered you go toe-to-toe with the Super Villain and his army with only one option for an ending. Explosive.

THE STREETS
The streets are the underbelly of Neo Tokyo and have 3 stand-alone districts which hold 36 key locations. The Villains henchmen are causing chaos across the city. It has become a monstrous jungle war between the treacherous and the savage. The Villain needs to destroy three landmarks to throw the city into proper chaos and take control of the primary levers. You must defend the streets while building an ally army and when you’re ready, end the chaos.

PUBLIC FEAR
During play the Villain will trigger events that spook the general public. The higher the Public Fear meter rises the more carnage the Villain will rain down on the city. Gain reputation with influencers and they will use their platforms to try and calm the public.

MISSIONS
There are 126 missions offering reputation and gadget rewards. When visiting locations around the city you can access Mission Control to see what missions are available and select at least one.

ENEMY AND ALLY POOLS
The enemy pool builds randomly during play, these forces are inserted into a scenario when they are triggered. A Landmark is triggered when 3 enemies appear on it. You build the ally pool and those are the forces you use when a Landmark is triggered.

LANDMARKS
There are 12 Landmarks across the city. Each has a unique one-shot combat scenario. When a Landmark is triggered place the scenario on the board, try to defuse the situation and exit with as much loot as possible. If an ally does not reach an exit they are removed from your forces.

POINTS of INTEREST (POI)
In order to hack from the streets Liquid Squid must enter a POI. POI's can be destroyed as well but do not count as Landmarks. Most missions involve POI locations and NPC's from those locations.

HACKING
HACK INTO THE ENVIRONMENT AND ENEMIES
Liquid Squid is a balanced dance between physical combat and hacking. If you have an angry mob on the other side of the city, not a problem. Hack in and set-off a Regulator Alarm, that will make ‘em scatter. Facing an overpowered enemy? No problem. Hack into his system, overload it and watch the fire works. The synergy between problem solving, physical combat and hacking is what makes Liquid Squid so enjoyable.

In order to hack there has to be a Mobile Hub in the district. You will always have a 50% chance that there is a Mobile Hub in the district. But you can gain control of Mobile Hubs and dedicate them to certain districts granting 100% hacking as long as you maintain control of the Mobile Hub.
In order to hack the streets, Liquid Squid must launch the hack from a Point of Interest. In a scenario she must launch a hack from a Hack Entry Point. Hacking consists of O-Hack/D-Hack gadgets, Offensive/Defensive Programs (Oprog/Dprog) and NODES.

FACTIONS
The Syndicate (Ally)
The Syndicate are a network of gangs in the Tokyo Underbelly lead by Robert Crisp. Attain Ally status with Crisp and they will join you in your fight.

Regulators (Ally)
The Regulators are corporate security and the law in Neo Tokyo. Attain Ally Status with Chief Yamasaki and they will join you in battle.

The Coda (Enemy)
The Coda are the Villains henchmen. They are a mixed bag of characters with a wide range of mod limits. They are exceedingly loyal to their boss, relentless terrorists and your sworn enemy.

Outliers (Enemy)
Outliers are the Villains Praetorian Guard. They have taken exceptionally well to merging with machines and poses a fervor to watch the world burn.

Mercs (Ally)
Mercs are deadly mercenaries for hire. They have a natural disdain for oppressors and Outliers in particular. Mercs further modify their Mods for optimum carnage. Mercs will join Liquid Squid free of charge.

Drones (Enemy)
These nasty machines are the Super Villains master assassins. They have destroyed the competition, even Regulator Drones. Now they only exist to hunt you and your ilk.

Block Rockers (Enemy)
Block Rockers are massive mechs with on board sentient AI. They will cut off passage through the block and are chock full of Gank Rating. Each of the three types of Block Rocker requires a specific gadget to engage them.

The Chimera (Enemy)
The Chimera are mutants who suffered grotesque side effects from merging with machines. Chimera can be found in the Underbelly and below. Besides general carnage they also maintain coordinated attacks of "The Pen" above.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Shattered City
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Shattered City is a roleplaying game about occupation and revolution in a fantasy world ravaged by war. Together you’ll build a city and sketch out its wonders and scars. You’ll take the reins of factions working to bring freedom to this city – or the foreign Guild sent to bring it to heel. You’ll make the heroes of this city: bold warriors, civic leaders, and uncanny mystics. And together you’ll tell the tale of this place’s struggle for freedom.

As flashpoints threaten to set the city ablaze, as you fight to pull down the occupying forces or work within their systems to earn yourself prosperity, as you work with the others to find moments of beauty and hope, what sort of community will you build? And what mysteries will you uncover along the way?

boardgame.name: Higurashi When They Cry - Chapter 7: Minagoroshi
boardgame.description:
Developer Blurb

June, 1983.

The summer heat has arrived earlier than it does most years.
By day there are cicadas, and by night, the higurashi.

Hinamizawa, a small village in the Japanese countryside.
While there are fewer than two thousand people there, every year, 'something' happens.

For the past 4 years, someone has died, and someone else has gone missing.
This series of deaths and disappearances is connected to the local resistance against a now-abandoned dam construction project.
A murder during the construction, covered up by the local authorities, is being re-enacted year after year.
Is it a conspiracy? A coincidence? Or perhaps a curse?

Someone who was supposed to be there... isn't.
Someone who wasn't supposed to be there... is.

Someone who was alive last night is now dead, and someone who is here right now isn't alive.

There is no way to avert this tragedy. There is no choice but to give up trying.

But even so... please don't give up.

boardgame.name: Jutland: Fleet Admiral II
boardgame.description:
The original Fleet Admiral was designed in the mid-1980’s by Jack Greene while running Quarterdeck Games, a small part-time vanity press producing cardboard and paper war-games. The game is a highly-sought after collector's item on ebay; commanding top dollar. Fast-forward to today, and Consim Press is collaborating with Jack Greene on an all-new game to celebrate the 100th Anniversary of the Battle of Jutland. This game will represent a major step forward in WWI naval warfare, along with high production value (without breaking the bank like the ebay collector's item).

Jack Greene was approached three times between 1990 and 2010 on producing the game professionally with a full print run. Now it is to be published by Consim Press. It is occurring now because over the past two years, Jack had an epiphany in approaching the game design. This is an example where historical research led Jack to eliminate player actions that hampered play and to change various values in the ship roster sheets and combat tables (used for resolving combat) to better reflect this deeper understanding of naval combat between Great Britain and Germany in the 1914-16 period.

Jutland: Fleet Admiral II will be a majestic mini-monster package; with 3 maps suitable for team play (yet playable enough for only 1-2 players) in experiencing this epic naval engagement while also providing smaller battle scenarios that can be played on 1-2 maps.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Higurashi When They Cry - Chapter 8: Matsuribayashi
boardgame.description:
Developer Blurb

June, 1983.

The summer heat has arrived earlier than it does most years.
By day there are cicadas, and by night, the higurashi.

Hinamizawa, a small village in the Japanese countryside.
While there are fewer than two thousand people there, every year, 'something' happens.

For the past 4 years, someone has died, and someone else has gone missing.
This series of deaths and disappearances is connected to the local resistance against a now-abandoned dam construction project.
A murder during the construction, covered up by the local authorities, is being re-enacted year after year.
Is it a conspiracy? A coincidence? Or perhaps a curse?

Someone who was supposed to be there... isn't.
Someone who wasn't supposed to be there... is.

Someone who was alive last night is now dead, and someone who is here right now isn't alive.

There is no way to avert this tragedy. There is no choice but to give up trying.

But even so... please don't give up.

boardgame.name: Record of Grancrest War
boardgame.description:
Atlatan, a continent where chaos rules everything.
People are frightened by the disaster caused by chaos,
and have lived under the protection of the "monarch" who has the power to calm it.

However, one day the princes abandon the idea of ​​"protecting the people" and plunge into a war of competing for each other's sacred marks and territory-in the midst of which, with the lonely wizard Siruka who despises the princes without the idea , The wandering knight Theo, who continues his training journey to free his hometown from oppression, meets.

Siruka's brute force strategy, which touched on Theo's ideals, led the two to sign a master-slave contract, transforming the war-torn continent.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Defense Grid: Reclamation of Atavio
boardgame.description:
In Defense Grid: The Board Game, a co-operative deck-building game based on the Defense Grid video game franchise, you and your fellow players must face off against waves and waves of aliens as you try to #ProtectTheCores. How you construct your deck for each mission is just as important as where you place your towers and which ones you choose to power each round.

Reclamation of Atavio is a Defense Grid: The Board Game campaign expansion consisting of 24 individual scenarios that are narratively and mechanically linked. The scenarios feature a couple of new mechanisms, such as tower unlocks, individual card rewards, Boss-Aliens, and specific map rules, in addition to narration from iconic characters of the computer game such as Fletcher, Cai, Rissler, and others in a novel (non-canon) tale within the lore of Defense Grid.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Defense Grid: The Board Game

boardgame.name: Breizhit
boardgame.description:
Breizhit is a game of questions and humor with very simple rules.

The adult cards offer 5 themes per card:

general culture
trivia on Brittany
mimes
Breton language (or nature for the kids version)
"light" theme


You have to rebuild the Brittany puzzles (1 per team) by answering questions randomly selected.

3 ways to play:

one against one
per team
all players against the game!

boardgame.name: What's for Dinner
boardgame.description:
Players are each given a menu of foods that need to be filled on their plate board. Each food piece is laid face down and mixed up, and the game begins. Each player chooses one card, and if it matches an item on their menu, they add it to their plate. If it doesn’t match, they turn it face down and play moves to the next person. Each food item is represented on one card, with the exception of entrees, which are split up onto two cards. Players will need to find both halves in order to complete their meal.

While each menu requires certain foods, drinks and desserts are not menu-specific, so a player may take any they find. If on a later turn they find another drink or dessert, their turn simply ends.

The only item found on each menu is peas, and there are two cards in the game which state “Please Pass the Peas”. If a player finds one, they are allowed to take peas from another player who has them on their plate. If no player has peas, they may hold the card until either they find peas, or an opponent does. Once a “please Pass the Peas” card is used, it is removed from play. The first player to successfully fill their plate with all required menu items wins.

boardgame.name: A Year In...
boardgame.description:
You are the mayor of a brand new village! Place features to attract villagers, then welcome them to town.

Each turn, you draw a card from a deck of standard playing cards. All players use the card value or suite to place features, welcome new villagers to town, or construct a store.

Once the deck runs out, the game is over and the player with the most villagers and shopkeepers wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Nicolas Eymerich - The Inquisitor - Book 2 : The Village
Nicolas Eymerich, Inquisitore: Capitolo 2: Il Villaggio
boardgame.description:
Nicolas Eymerich, Inquisitor General of Aragona, is called upon to investigate an obscure case. Something that goes way beyond heresy, revealing a new face of Evil.

He must tackle a great number of arduous tasks and make many painful choices. This is the second chapter of four.

Play a remorseless character to live an original story inspired by the famous novel of Valerio Evangelisti.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Eymerich: Il Demone
Nicolas Eymerich Inquisitor - The Demon - Audiogame
boardgame.description:
The inquisitor is back. Nicolas Eymerich has returned for the final battle!
The plague... the cursed village... the Devil's dark plan is revealed in the final chapter of the Inquisitor saga.
Engaging game mechanics in 8 different scenarios: haunted woods, caves swarming with monstrous creatures, crypts full of secrets and a final battle with the Devil.
An innovative audio-navigation system for exploring the remotest corners of the maps.
From the village of Calcares to the dungeons of the abbey. Over seventy different rooms.
Combat mechanics that allow you to control both Eymerich and Jacinto Corona.
You'll use the strength, spirit and power of the Faith.
Dialogues that give you important clues or evidence of the heretic lie.
Puzzles to solve with the ingenuity of divine intuition.
An accessible audio game for the visually impaired, enhanced with hand-drawn graphics and also playable in video mode.
An Infinite game mode for embarking on new adventures even after you have completed the game.The lenght of the game is more than twelve hours.

Nicolas Eymerich Inquisitor: The Demon.
Laudetur!

From https://store.steampowered.com/app/1108310/The_Demon__Nicola...

N.B. This includes chapters 3 and 4 of Nicolas Eymerich - The Inquisitor, concluding the series.

boardgame.name: Dragon's Hoard 1
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Dragon's Hoard 1 presents a variety of alternate class abilities and builds.

From the introduction:

A compilation of way too many homebrews.

boardgame.name: Dragon's Hoard 2
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Dragon's Hoard 2 presents a variety of dragons (monsters).

From the introduction:

A compilation of way too many homebrews.

boardgame.name: Dragon's Hoard 3
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Dragon's Hoard 3 presents a variety of alternate class abilities and builds, several adventures, and a variety of dragons (monsters).

Note the book is provided as a single PDF document or as three separate PDF documents divided by topic.

From the introduction:

A compilation of way too many homebrews.

boardgame.name: Prehistorica
boardgame.description:
With the light of a new dawn, a clan of Neanderthals wake by a smouldering fire. They’re hungry and tired of eating berries and small game. Excitement soon spreads like wildfire as they peer from their cave, across the vast grasslands and forests to the clear mountain peaks beyond. The clouds have lifted, and a warm sun softens the snow around them. Winter has passed and soon to follow are the giants of fur and bone; the mighty Mammoths!

Prehistorica is a two-player asymmetric deck-deconstruction board game in which one player managers a tribe of Neanderthals and the other migrates a herd of Mammoths.

As the Neanderthals, you’ll have to gather resources, build traps, and craft weaponry to succeed in hunting the Mammoths. As the Mammoths, you’ll have to fend off attacks and migrate through three different territories; the grasslands, forests, and mountains – grazing and eating plenty of berries along the way – until you are safe from the Neanderthals’ hunting party.

The Neanderthals win if they successfully hunt all four Mammoths, and the Mammoths win if they successfully migrate across the board with at least one surviving member of the herd.

For the Neanderthals, this is the most prosperous time of year… but for the Mammoths, it’s the most dangerous leg of their journey.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Tank Board Game
boardgame.description:
Tank Board Game is a board game of armored battles of WW2. Its central focus is armor with minimal infantry rules. The attacking player tries to capture 3 of the defender’s 4 towns by game turn 15, while the defender tries to keep 2 of his towns.

Players move their tanks on a square grid gameboard trying to get a clear shot at the thinner side or rear armor plate of the enemy tank. Players can also move their tanks to higher-level positions and shoot down onto the enemy tank’s thinner top. When a shot is taken, the tank's ability to destroy the other tank depends on its gun's penetration at target range, the thickness of the armor plate hit (turret/hull: front, side, rear, or top), and the angle the shell hits (level shot or falling shot & full-face or quarter hit). Shot resolution is simplified using 3 randomly drawn chits (hit/miss, hit location, and critical hit) and then a quick table to find the effective armor vs. the gun’s penetration. Armor plate thickness and gun penetration are all historical based.

The “Starter Rules” include only tank vs tank direct-fire combat. The “Advanced Rules” cover tank hunters, armored cars, self-propelled guns, armored personnel carriers, towed guns and aircraft. They cover indirect fire, rockets, and close infantry combat. In addition, they cover mechanical reliability, smoke, mines, demolitions, pontoon bridges, airborne, weather, and an optional concealment rule.

A total of 24 scenarios are provided: eight “Starter” scenarios and 16 historical “Advanced” scenarios. The starter scenarios include common favorites: M-4 vs Panther, T34 vs Panther, and M-4 vs T-34 (Korea). The historical scenarios start with the invasion of Poland with an optional armored train, and end with “Into Germany” putting armored goliaths against each other. Scenarios are designed to provide near-balanced fun games featuring 30-40 tanks and supporting units of the period, with the “feel” of the campaign in which the scenario took place. Two gameboards (Northern Europe and North Africa), 295 units of 163 types, as well as markers and chits are provided.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: ATS: Ridge Runners of Toktong Pass
boardgame.description:
Along the road between KOTO-RI and HAGARU-RI, KOREA, 29 November 1950: As the head of Task Force Drysdale fought its way through to Hagaru-ri, a miscellaneous assortment of British and American soldiers found themselves cut off, stranded in Hell Fire Valley for the night. As Marine air and artillery support tapered off at dusk, the remnants of the convoy now consisted of two large perimeters and three splinter groups, stretching over a distance of 1,200 yards. In the containment were 52 British Marines from the 41st Independent Commando, 190 men from Company B, 31st Infantry Regiment, and about 150 Marine service troops. There was no ammunition on hand for the 60mm mortars, and no heavy weapons. The Chinese took their time, probing and scouting before finally setting up one mortar on the right flank, and another on the left. Luckily, their fire wasn’t accurate, as the British and American positions were hardly advantageous to the defense. Major J. N. McLaughlin and a veteran Marine MP, Warrant Officer Lloyd V. Dirst soon rose to the occasion, the former gathering the men in the northern group into a tight defensive perimeter and the latter striding about, smoking his pipe, and barking out orders. Later in the night the valiant MP was hit by a mortar round, suffering a serious head wound. Twice the men led by Major McLaughlin drove the Chinese from their mortar positions, only to have them return. By 0200 Hours, no grenades remained and orders were issued to fix bayonets. At one point the major called for the enemy to surrender. In the brief lull that followed about 100 men of the southern perimeter managed to escape. As daybreak approached the Chinese withdrew to the hills, providing an opportunity to evacuate the wounded. Among them was Warrant Officer Dirst, who survived only to die of his wounds a year later.

We heard what you wanted and here it is AND then some. Areyou ready for a completely new take on Toktong Pass? Winterized, new retro terrain, Then you are ready to get your mittens on and join your fellow Frozen Chosin Marines and prepare for the next enemy attack.

You receive a brand new Winterized map, 10 scenarios that all play on the winterized map, in color format, plus BW 3-hole punch color special rules!

—'description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: ATS Rulebook 2014

boardgame.name: La Boîte: Quelle est votre destination ?
boardgame.description:
Find the Routard (famous French backpacker guide) atmosphere in this unique question-answer game that will take you on a journey from your living room!
Choose a destination number, answer questions on monuments, countries, culinary art or even films and books, use flash codes to guess a place on a photo, act out a situation to make yourself understood ...
With each correct answer you gain a clue to find the destination to discover!
The first to find his unknown destination wins!


6 categories:
Around the world
Triporteur
Flash-code
Travel
G'palémo (signs/drawings to make yourself understood in any language)
Unknown destinations



And bonus: 1 guide to the Routard favorites

boardgame.name: X-Men: Mojo World
boardgame.description:
User Summary

X-Men: Mojo World is 2d side scrolling action game. Players begin with either Wolverine or Rogue. After defeating each level, a new superhero will be made available.

The plot of the game takes place in a dark future, and Mojo is the evil villain who has his own show where contestants fight to the death. He has imprisoned some of X-men to battle on his show. The player fights to release the imprisoned X-Men.

boardgame.name: Vinyl: Holiday Edition
Vinyl: Seasons Greetings
boardgame.description:
The fireplace crackles. The smell of pine is in the air. The family gathers to enjoy each other's company during this holiday season. In the corner of the room, a record player fills the room with warm, soothing tunes from classic holiday albums. The crate of albums is positioned near, holding onto the many memories connected of years past. Family members take turns getting up and selecting an album, studying the cover, and sliding the album out of the jacket to load onto the player. As the needle pops and crackles, the wonderful music enchants the room and seems to synchronize with the twinkle of the lights on the Christmas Tree. It is another Vinyl: Holiday!

In Vinyl: Holiday, players will work towards building Christmas trees out of albums. Each album features a sub-genre (Classical, Traditional, and Contemporary), one of four decades (the 40s, 50s, 60s, 70s), one of five spirits (Joy, Love, Peace, Hope, and Faith). These album trees are being built by the players to your left and right in the true holiday spirit. Some of the points you gain are entirely in your control with the matches you make with previously played albums. Other points come from the combined efforts of you and the players to your left and right. To further increase the scoring opportunities, each player can sacrifice their hand size to complete attributes printed on each album's gift tags. Vinyl: Holiday Edition will be a game that you will want to play all year round.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Azure Striker Gunvolt 3
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.




Azure Striker Gunvolt 3, known as Armed Blue: Gunvolt 3 /// Gibs (蒼き雷霆 ガンヴォルト 鎖環) in Japan, is an upcoming game produced by Inti Creates in development for the Nintendo Switch, and marks the return of the mainline Azure Striker Gunvolt series since 2016's Azure Striker Gunvolt 2.

Gunvolt once again returns as a playable character, with a seemingly overhauled moveset, lacking the Flashfield entirely. Joining him is a new playable character named Kirin, who uses a mix of ranged and melee attacks with her sword and enchanted talismans.

boardgame.name: Phanfare (Ausgabe 3 - 1992)
boardgame.description:
Looking back on fanzine publications from the year 1992, Phanfare #3 reviews

Sturmvogel #1
Artefakt #1
Free-Int
Sanduhr #2
Beilunker Reiter #9


and many others.

boardgame.name: Pizza Party Throwdown
boardgame.description:
Pizza Party Throwdown, the crazy new pizza toppings game! Players have 30 seconds to toss their “ingredients” onto the rotating pizza game board. It’s a rush against time to land your ingredients on the pizza before it finishes “baking!” Each player selects their color-coded ingredient – like pepperoni, peppers, mushrooms and of course, anchovies! Launch it onto the pizza using the special pizza chef launcher game piece.

Great for all ages! Three different challenges deliver various levels of difficulty, like trying to fill only half of your pizza, or land your ingredients on only one slice! Includes rotating pizza game board with built-in timer, four launchers and 32 ingredients.
—description from the publisher

In the game Pizza Party Throwdown there are three different ways to play but each one consists of players using catapult-like launchers to toss their ingredients onto the spinning cardboard pizza before the pizza stops spinning. In most cases, whoever has the most of their toppings on the pizza wins. Different play modes include simply having to put all of your toppings on the pizza first, putting all of your toppings on only one half of the pizza first, or putting two different toppings onto two different quarter sections of the pizza first.

boardgame.name: Beatdown!
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Beatdown! is a minimalist/micro RPG system, designed to provide a simple solution to running cinematic fight scenes and brawls, either within another existing RPG setting, or as a stand-alone mini-game, lasting 10-15 minutes. Beatdown! Focuses on one thing: two or more fighters coming to blows in a vicious street-fight.

Beatdown! uses a simple degrading dice pool that disappears as fighters exert themselves and take damage from an opponents attacks - once the dice pool is empty, the fighter is defeated. The last fighter standing, wins!

Round one... FIGHT!

boardgame.name: Strange Creature, Strange Land
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Strange Creature, Strange Land is a minimalist/micro RPG system, designed to provide a simple solution to turning great stories into usable tabletop gaming scenarios. As the title may suggest, the game focuses on unusual little creatures exploring and adventuring in fantastical lands.

The concept is simple; the GM pits a group of strange creatures against a quest into unknown lands. Creatures have amazing capabilities, but being small and inexperienced as adventurers, they do have a tendency to wear themselves out. As such, a creature’s ability to make ‘tests’ and overcome obstacles is limited and they should try not to overexert themselves, to avoid getting exhausted before the adventure ends.

boardgame.name: MicroMacro: Crime City – Granny Maureen
MicroMacro: Crime City – Mamie Mauricette
MicroMacro: Crime City – Oma Erna
boardgame.description: 1 print & play bonus case which can be downloaded after newsletter registration. The English version of this 3-card case is titled "Granny Maureen"
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Admin: Outside the Scope of BGG
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: MicroMacro: Crime City

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Codex: Ectoplasm 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Description:

Let the Night One In - This is our very first "sweeps week" mystery for Brindlewood Bay. In American television, sweeps week is when TV networks release unusual or stunt episodes of popular TV shows in order to juice ratings. In that spirit, this new type of mystery finds our Murder Mavens involved in cases that have nothing to do with the Midwives conspiracy. They have a more overtly supernatural vibe, and are not necessarily about solving murders. This first sweeps week mystery is by Alicia Furness (who also gave this new type of mystery its name) and features the first appearance of the mysterious author hinted at in the Brindlewood Bay rules, Robin Masterson. Sweeps week mysteries introduce new gameplay elements into Brindlewood Bay, and we think you're going to love them.

My Partner the Ghost - This is an original game by Dan Brown and Sam Zimmerman about a living investigator and their ghostly partner. 1 GM and 2 players will work together to craft and solve a mystery at the table. The Investigator and the Ghost have different abilities, with each being able to access information that the other cannot. As you play, you'll be revealing the history of this pair, as well as determining their connection to the mystery at hand. This game is very easy to get to the table, requiring just a few dice and some index cards, and features a unique Attunement mechanic inside its Powered by the Apocalypse chassis. As a side note, we have a special channel on the Gauntlet Publishing Discord for discussing this game, so if you get a chance to play or have any questions, please let us know over there: https://discord.gg/jxDbMXV

Noble Rot - This is a brand-new Trophy Gold incursion by Jen Stacey. In this extremely dark and ghoulish incursion, you'll be uncovering the dark history of a nobleman's vineyard and shaking loose the ghosts of a very troubled past. Unlike many fantasy dungeons, this one de-emphasizes violence. It's trappings are extremely bleak and gory, but players are encouraged to approach these tortured souls in the vineyard with compassion and gentleness. It's a very special incursion, and if you get a chance to play it, we hope you'll let us know how it goes on the Trophy Discord: https://discord.gg/eFBR2Vg

Three Dozen MORE Signs of Ghostly Habitation - The newest miscellany is a sequel to the much-loved original in Codex - Ectoplasm. Get your ghostly inspiration right here!

boardgame.name: オフトゥンからの脱出拡張02～転入生は蟹高専生!?～ (Ofuto~un kara no dasshutsu Exp 02 ~ ten'nyūsei wa kani kōsen-sei!?~)
boardgame.description:
オフトゥンからの脱出拡張02～転入生は蟹高専生!?～ (Ofuto~un kara no dasshutsu Exp 02 ~ ten'nyūsei wa kani kōsen-sei!?~) is the second expansion to オフトゥンからの脱出 (Ofutun kara no Dasshutsu). The expansion comes in a larger box, made to fit both the original game box and the two expansion decks. The second expansion adds 41 cards, of which 29 are new lesson cards. The new cards enable a sixth player.

In this expansion (~Transfer students are crab college students?~), the students are still struggling to complete their coursework and get enough sleep. There are new arrivals, transfer students from Crab College, who work together to make crab cans, which the students take home for their cats.
user summary
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: オフトゥンからの脱出 (Ofutun kara no Dasshutsu)

boardgame.name: Marvel: War of Heroes
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Marvel: War of Heroes was a collectible card game on mobile devices. Players assembled their team comprised from the characters on their cards. Each different card provided the heroes a different superpower which could be upgraded. As players defeated each mission, players could earn additional cards to recruit new heroes or upgrade their current hero powers.

boardgame.name: Scooby Doo (GBA)
boardgame.description:
The Scooby Gang must solve the mysteries of Spooky Island. Based on the live action motion picture, players must reunite the bickering gang, solve mysteries and fight the island demons. Every member of Mystery, Inc. is available as a playable character with different abilities; Velma solves puzzles (mini-games) and can go unnoticed, Fred can fight, Daphne knows karate, Shaggy and Scooby can run, and run even faster, leaving enemies spinning in place. The player switches between each available character, as few as two, up to then entire Scooby Gang of Five, to progress through the world. Talk to people, collect clues and Scooby Snacks and solve the mysteries (quests) they present you, and fight off the monsters that have taken over Spooky Island.

In addition to the main gameplay, 4 mini-games are included, each of which aid the player in advancing through the game, by opening chests, turning on lights, fixing pipes and such.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Digimon Battle Spirit 2
boardgame.description:
The game is a versus battle game, where one of the Human Spirit Digimon fights the other. Unlike most fighting games, the winner is not determined by having the most health, but the most blue or red "D-Spirits", which are released whenever the player strikes an opponent. When the player has damaged the opponent enough to fill the gauge at the top, the character's Beast Spirit is activated whenever they attack, allowing them to temporarily digivolve to a higher level, and attack with greater force. Also, yellow diamonds are released during Beast Spirit attacks, and filling the diamond gauge enables the player to momentarily warp digivolve to Ancient Level and fire a powerful attack, before returning to normal (this depletes the diamond gauge to zero). Once all of the Human Spirit Digimon are defeated, the player must then defeat Cherubimon. Cherubimon's name is Kerpymon in this game.

There is also a mini-game, where Digimon are used like marbles, and are fired at other Digimon on the board to knock them out of the arena.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digimon_Battle_Spirit_2 Digimon Battle Spirit 2]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Scooby-Doo and the Cyber Chase
boardgame.description:
Scooby-Doo and the gang find themselves in cyberspace. A new villain called the Phantom Virus must be stopped. Scooby and Shaggy must go through various levels to defeat him and his evil villains. Along the way they collect Scooby Snacks for points, Scooby and Shaggy coins for extra chances, Scooby dog tags for checkpoints, hamburgers for health/energy, and pies for weapons. Fred, Daphne, and Velma help Scooby and Shaggy to overcome obstacles by giving them important game playing moves and tips via Velma's handheld communication device.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scooby-Doo_and_the_Cyber_Chase_%28video_game%29 Scooby-Doo and the Cyber Chase (video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Pinball Advance
boardgame.description:
Pinball Advance is a puzzle game on Gameboy Advance. The app offers 3 pinball tables. The Dare Devil which uses the theme of big cars, the Jail Break which deals with the escape from a prison, or the Tarantula which deals with a big spider.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: WWE Road to WrestleMania X8
boardgame.description:
WWE Road to WrestleMania X8 is a professional wrestling video game released on the Game Boy Advance handheld console by THQ in 2002, based on WWE's 2002 pay-per-view WrestleMania X8, their biggest show of the year. The game featured improved gameplay and grappling techniques compared to its predecessors. This game was the Game Boy Advance successor to WWF Road to WrestleMania from 2001. The game was succeeded by WWE Survivor Series released in 2004. WWE also released WWE WrestleMania X8 for the GameCube in June 2002, making the GBA game in a way the "prequel", despite WrestleMania X8 being published five months prior.

The controls for the game are very limited, as the hand-held Game Boy Advance platform has space for few buttons and devices. Also, very limited external devices can be used to add on to the already existing game features, although it does allow for four player options through direct link cables. [[WWE Survivor Series (video game)|WWE Survivor Series] and WWF Road to WrestleMania were the only other versions of the WWE games developed by Natsume for the GBA, and earned only average reviews from the gaming world. WWE Road to WrestleMania X8 was the most successful out of the three games in regard to both sales and reviews.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WWE_Road_to_WrestleMania_X8 WWE Road to WrestleMania X8]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Bruce Lee: Return of the Legend
boardgame.description:
Bruce Lee: Return of the Legend is a 2003 action beat 'em up developed by Vicarious Visions for the Game Boy Advance. It was first published and released in Europe by Vivendi Universal Games on March 21, 2003, and was later published and released in North America on March 28, 2003.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bruce_Lee%3A_Return_of_the_Legend Bruce Lee: Return of the Legend]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: El Gran Golpe
boardgame.description:
El Gran Golpe (The Big Heist) is a game that simulates a robbery in 3 different rooms (rounds). By using cards and unique abilities depending on the character, you will have to be the player with the most money to accumulate.

You choose a character at random, start the player who has visited a mansion most recently and deal 5 cards to each player. The maximum number of cards changes depending on the round you are in, but the minimum is always 3.

The game starts, in each turn you can:

1- Roll the dice and use your unique ability and/or use as many cards as you want, although "Looting", "Decoy", "Mirror", "Duplicate" and "Secret Passage" can only be used once until your next turn.
2- Show a card. You put a card face up.
3- Draw a card. Choose the card face up or draw the next card in the deck face down.

These are the actions that each one of you can do, thanks to the cards you can get money or steal it from your rivals. With the skills you can gain an advantage by drawing cards from the rest of the opponents or from the deck.

Shifts run clockwise. The winner is decided in 3 rounds. A round is finished when the "Art Gallery/Vault" card appears, at this time all players discard their hand and the money is counted. The money that you are getting can be stolen by your enemies, but once a round is finished, the money that you have obtained in it will be insured. You will play the third round until the cards in the deck are used up.

—description from publisher


El Gran Golpe es un juego que simula un robo en 3 habitaciones diferentes (rondas). Mediante el uso de cartas y habilidades únicas según el personaje, tendréis que lograr ser el jugador que más dinero logre acumular.

Elegís personaje al azar, empieza el jugador que haya visitado una mansión más recientemente y repartís 5 cartas a cada jugador. El número máximo de cartas cambia según la ronda en la que estéis, pero el mínimo siempre es 3.

Empieza el juego, en cada turno podéis:

1- Lanzar el/los dados y usar vuestra habilidad única y/o utilizar tantas cartas como queráis, aunque “Saqueo”, “Señuelo”, “Espejo”, “Duplicar” y “Pasadizo Secreto” solo se pueden utilizar una vez hasta vuestro siguiente turno.
2- Pintar una carta. Ponéis una carta boca arriba para que todos la vean.
3- Robar una carta. Elegid la carta boca arriba o robad boca abajo la siguiente carta del mazo.

Estas son las acciones que podéis hacer cada uno, gracias a las cartas podéis conseguir dinero o robárselo a vuestros rivales. Con las habilidades podéis ganar ventaja robando cartas del resto de contrincantes o del mazo.

Los turnos transcurren en sentido horario. El ganador se decide en 3 rondas. Una ronda se termina cuando aparece la carta "Galería de Arte/Cámara acorazada", en este momento todos los jugadores desechan su mano y se hace el recuento de dinero. El dinero que vais consiguiendo puede ser robado por vuestros enemigos, pero una vez se termina una ronda, el dinero que habéis conseguido en ella quedará asegurado. La tercera ronda la jugaréis hasta que se agoten las cartas que hay en el mazo. (Spanish)

boardgame.name: Umihara Kawase BaZooKa!
boardgame.description:
Umihara Kawase BaZooKa! is a fast-paced action game where the players goal is to clear the screen of enemies by performing skillful combos with their Bazooka and an extraordinary fishing rod. Choose your fighter out of 22 iconic characters and complete the Challenge Mode with 40 stages!

The stages feature moving platforms, perilous obstacles and quirky enemy sea life. Not forgetting the other players, of course! Expect multiplayer action at its very best, either in versus mode or as party fun for up to 4 players online and offline!

• Fast-paced Battle Action for 1-4 players
• Online & couch multiplayer on 40 stages
• Strong competitive gameplay
• Online leaderboard ranking
• 22 beloved characters to choose from
• Each character has a different special move
• Classic 2D single screen platform action
• Find opponents from different countries for a quick match

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Umihara Kawase Fresh!
boardgame.description:
When a young traveling chef named Kawase arrives in the frontier town of Kingness, she finds it to be a perfect real-life replica of a town that she used to dream of as a child. Intrigued, she takes a job as a delivery person and occasional chef for a local restaurant. Through exploration and conversations with the locals, Kawase gradually learns the history of the town, the mysterious castle that floats above it, the dangerous cavern that lurks below it and the unspeakable demons who have terrorized its residents.

In Umihara Kawase Fresh!, Kawase carries a fishing lure with “rubber-band action.” The lure can be used as a grappling hook to swing from platforms, as a winch to raise or lower herself while suspended, as a bungee cord to slingshot herself in any direction and as a weapon to stun or defeat enemies. The lure can also capture enemies and items in the environment, pulling them in to be stored in the infinite space of Kawase’s seemingly magical backpack.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Combat HQ: 2nd Edition
boardgame.description:
Combat HQ 2nd Edition presents fun, streamlined rules designed for large-scale world war two battles featuring rapid movement, decisive combat, and exciting decision making.

The new edition includes rules for close support units, a faster close assault system, extended artillery rules, and more opportunities to wage war on the battlefield.

Rapid Command Pulses and opposed dice rolls keep players constantly involved.
Easy-to-play rules emphasize command-and-control decisions over complex combat resolution mechanics.

In each Command Pulse you decide how to use your limited command resources:

will you use your Command Dice to move up a company of infantry supported by tanks?
Or will you use them to rally an anti-tank gun battery?
Or maybe you should use them to liaise with your staff officers?


The choice is yours.

'Unit Scale: The Platoon is the basic unit in the game and is represented by a model vehicle.

Ground Scale: 1” equals 50 yards.

Figure Scale: Plays equally well with 2mm, 6mm, 10mm, 15mm and 20mm figures. 28mm figures are possible, but a large table is required.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Kharkov, May 1942: The Last Disaster

boardgame.name: Doki Doki Poyacchio
boardgame.description:
Doki Doki Poyacchio is a PlayStation game released by King Records on September 10, 1998 .

It was released as a unique genre of active communication games. It's a kind of role-playing game , but it doesn't have the concept of fighting with enemies and experience points , and the hero's ability doesn't grow. There are also adventure games or elements of love.

Source: Wikipedia, "[ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%81%A9%E3%81%8D%E3%81%A9%E3%81%8D%E3%83%9D%E3%83%A4%E3%83%83%E3%83%81%E3%82%AA どきどきポヤッチオ]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: The Distant Marches: A Five Leagues From the Borderlands Expansion pack
boardgame.description:
Ahead of you lay a fiercely independent land of swamps, scattered village communities and hard-eyed people fighting for survival, as the fierce dusklings mount raid after raid.
It will take determination to win through here.

Welcome to a new campaign expansion for Five Leagues From the Borderlands, offering a brand new realm to explore. In a wet and rainy land, the feared dusklings are raiding ever more aggressively, leading to the call for heroes to hold the lines.

The Marches is a pre-configured campaign featuring 5 villages, each with their own special circumstance and threat levels. The battles here will put you against the Dusklings: Orc-like raiders terrorizing civilization.

The feature list includes:

Simple rules for special terrain conditions and campaign adjustments, reflecting the unique circumstances of the Marches.
Additional special rules for fighting the Duskling threat.
Each of the 5 villages you have to clear has a special rule applicable to it.
A new travel table for adventures in the Marches.
A modified Monster table, including the new Swamp Lurker.
10 Unique encounters to experience.
3 new locations to visit.
A 6 step quest adding new challenges and rewards as you play.


The Distant Marches is intended to be played with Five Leagues From the Borderlands 2nd edition version 1.03 or newer, though any version from 1.0 Marmoset should work fine.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Five Leagues from the Borderlands
Five Leagues From The Borderlands: 2nd Edition

boardgame.name: AtomBlitz: The 1st Anticrusade
boardgame.description:
The Great Global Depression of the 2020s destroyed the Free World. The economy is in permanent bankruptcy. Scientific and technological progress has reached the end of line. Education and culture have degraded.
The European Union and NATO have ceased to exist. Former allies are now preparing to tear each other apart.
The year is 2038. A new era of war begins with the clash of Islamist France and neo-fascist Spain. What kind of fanaticism is less repulsive to you?

AtomBlitz: The 1st Anticrusade is the first installation in a new series of tactical wargames about local nuclear wars of the near future. Take command of the army of obscurantists armed with the latest technology, and walk through the ruins of Western civilization with fire and tracks!

The mini-game set contains 1 A4 map depicting the border area of France and Spain, and two sheets of 14 mm counters for infantry units, ground and air combat vehicles. The four-mission campaign allows players to participate in a fierce two-day border battle of the post-hybrid warfare era armies.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Cepheus Journal (Issue 003)
boardgame.description:
From the website description

This is Cepheus Journal Issue #003 the third issue of Cepheus Journal. The theme for this issue is the Closest Stars. There is an article about Alpha Centauri and another one about Tau Ceti. There is also an article about Vega Subsector about a number of nearby worlds, based on the Near Stars map from Stellagama Publishing.

There are also some rules for Sword of Cepheus, rules for Factions, a Vietnamese Rifle Platoon for Modern War, a review of These Stars are Ours! and a Provincial Cruiser that you can find in the Vega Subsector.

Finally there are three very different alien races.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Additional Shield Rules for Sword of Cepheus
Disarm Rules for Sword of Cepheus
People's Army of Vietnam Rifle Platoon

boardgame.name: Tee oder Kaffee: Refill Kartensatz
boardgame.description:
This upgrade contains six Refill cards. These are added to a copy of Tee oder Kaffe to convert it to Tee oder Kaffee Refill.
Also included is a card with rules in German and English.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Tee oder Kaffee

boardgame.name: Skulls of Sedlec: Holiday Features
boardgame.description:
Two new Christmas themed features on 1 double-sided card to add to your solo games!


Christmas Tree
Bell


Requires Skulls of Sedlec and Monstrance expansion to play.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Skulls of Sedlec
Skulls of Sedlec: Monstrance

boardgame.name: CLIMB!
boardgame.description:
CLIMB! is a card game from Japan, for one or two players. The solitaire game pits the climber against the mountain, having to ascend and descend safely in order to win.

The two player game has the climber contending with the Mountain God too, trying to prevent the climber from ascending. This game can be played with the payers taking alternate roles, first the climber, then the mountain god, affecting how each will play their role.

The designer re-implemented this as the solo game TOZAN.
user summary

boardgame.name: Six Pack: Christmas Spells (PFRPG)
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This supplement has six spells for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game with a generally Christmas theme to them. These are low level spells and can be used to enliven a Christmas-themed adventure.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

The spells are as follows:

Animate Snowman
Bauble Shower
Grow Christmas Tree
Let it Snow
Snowball Swarm
Summon Reindeer

One page is the front cover, one the front matter, one and a half is ads and one the Open Game License.

boardgame.name: 100 Modern Street Encounters (DS&DS)
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This supplement has 100 encounters characters could have in the dark city in Dark Streets & Darker Secrets. In keeping with the game's darker theme, these encounters will be appropriately dark in some way. There may be criminal activities going on, violence, both deliberate and random, and dark plots by sinister groups. Many of the encounters allow characters to roll to determine the truth; in some they may have to delve deeper to find out what's really going on. The encounters can be used to enliven a city street or as a source of potential adventure hooks. It is a heavily modified version of 100 Events for a Modern Street.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are some sample results:

Overhead Cables: A crew is working on some electrical cables. Scaffolding stands on each side of the road and netting has been strung between the pylons to ensure that the cables don't fall to the ground. One of the workers slips as they are watched and their safety line comes lose. They tumble into one of the cables and are electrocuted, causing a few power surges as well. The accident wasn't an accident; the worker belonged to a criminal organisation and they were killed by a rival. A day later, the worker's soul will arise as a 3 HD Ghost.

People: A group of rowdy and drunk young men on a stag do are making their way noisily down the street, shouting comments and whistling at any attractive women. One of the women they shout at is a 4 HD Lust Daemon, who will attempt to seduce one of the young men away from the others to feed on them.

People: A pair of joggers wearing earphones are jogging down the pavement. Though they seem legitimate, they are two undercover 2 HD Police Officers.

People: A pedestrian trips and falls heavily to the pavement, suffering 1 point of damage as they do. The pedestrian falling over wasn't an accident, but was the work of a 1 HD Pixie that is playing pranks on those passing.

People: A smoker standing in a doorway asks for a light. They are a 1 HD Thug looking for suitable marks.

One page is the front cover, one the front matter, one and two thirds are ads and one the Open Game License.

boardgame.name: 100 Sci-Fi Gangs
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The cities rise to the sky, their spires of concrete, glass and steel alight with the promise of all the future may hold. But no matter how advanced technology gets, people will never change. As long as there is something deemed off-limits there are going to be those willing to buy it, sell it, trade it and do it. And as long as there are credits to be made, there are going to be gangs willing to do what it takes to put that money in their pockets.

Whether you're in a gritty cyberpunk cityscape, or an interstellar setting where distance is measured in light years instead of miles, these gangs will give you a little something to spice up your game with. From the backstreet racers of Octane 6, to high-tech low lifes of the Iron Brotherhood, there's something in here for every game set in the sci-fi future!

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are some sample results:

Black Knights: Some gangs cover themselves in colors and symbols, making sure they've got their heraldry on full display. The Black Knights don't need to. In their ballistic weave plate carriers, with batons on one hip and shooters slung on the other, they're recognizable at three dozen yards. While this gang has done dirty deeds for half a dozen different outfits, there are lines they won't cross; a kind of honor code that's earned them respect even from their rivals. More than just not crossing those lines, though, the Black Knights enact retribution on those who have crossed said lines, and not been properly punished for their transgressions. Traffickers, abusive pimps, child abusers and others have all mysteriously dropped off the radar when the Black Knights came for them. Some reappeared, bloody and beaten, eager to confess their crimes to the security forces so they could be arrested. Others were never seen again.

Roaches: Made up of the worst scum ever to get caught in the drains, the Roaches simply will not die. Known for doing any dirty deed no matter how repugnant, the Roaches actually subcontract a lot of street dealing, transport and enforcement duties for more successful outfits... as long as they keep it on the down-low about who they're working for. Because a lot of gangs are more than happy to let them take the risks, but they don't want anyone else knowing they're shaking hands with the Roaches behind the scenes.

Redliners: Boomers and arsonists, the Redliners combine their love of mayhem with the industrial stock exchange to create a match made in hell. This gang is alleged to have helped traders short stocks while sabotaging company prototypes, destroying supply chains, wrecking pipelines and doing all manner of malicious things that can funnel money into their and their allies' pockets. The advantage of working with such high-powered corporate interests is that, in addition to getting a share of the spoils, when members of the gang are arrested there's always a team of high-powered suits ready to show up and take their case. There's no way to track the lawyers back to the Redliners' allies, but they understand the nature of their working relationship.

Burners: The easiest way to get caught is to pull the same job again and again; that's why the Burners don't do repeat performances. This gang's teams are always changing as they take on one-timers and contractors, using single-service phones, terminals and even weapons to make sure there's no way to trace the tools back to them. When the job is done everyone takes their cut, and goes their separate ways. The Burners aren't even on most security force's radars, because everything they do looks like random, unconnected crimes rather than the acts of a single, coordinated core. Which is, of course, by design.

The Five Rings: An organization of fences, the Five Rings are the ones who set the value for stolen property of all sorts in the areas they control. Guided by a code of secrecy, the Five Rings hold no favor for any buyer or seller, or the circumstances that brought them to the syndicate. The organization ensures that all trades are kept blind, and there have been several times when wealthy buyers have had valuable art, jewelry or heirlooms stolen from them, only to have to buy them back from the Five Rings. Out of respect, however, the gang always gives the injured party the chance to make a closed bid on important, personal goods. If negotiations fail, however, then the items will go to a much broader, general auction.

One page is the front cover, one page the front matter and half a page is ads.

boardgame.name: 100 Individuals and Groups to Meet on the Road
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

When characters are travelling between places on the roads and paths, there are going to be other travellers, groups and individuals, pedestrians and riders, on the routes as well. This supplement has 100 different travellers and groups that can enliven a journey. Some of the travellers are innocuous, some are interesting and some may be a potential threat. Others can be a potential source of adventure hooks. Small groups and individuals have all the travellers named; larger groups just the principal NPC.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are some sample results:

Ianta Beteringay: Ianta is wearing priest's attire and is at the head of a troupe of fourteen pilgrims. They are heading from their temple on a short pilgrimage to several holy sites in the area and are singing hymns as they approach. Ianta and their flock will stop and greet others on the road, attempting to convince them to join their religion; the pilgrims are rather pushy about this.

Indigo Mantaya: Indigo is dressed in sturdy travelling clothes and, on seeing groups of travellers on the road, will immediately offer their services as a guide. They are so over the top enthusiastic that they can often come across as suspicious, but the offer is perfectly genuine and Indigo is a skilled guide who knows the local area very well.

Innis Marn, Lothia Tiblan and Brok Cartharg: Innis is a young woman travelling with her chaperone, Lothia, and their bodyguard, the large, strong and well-armed and armoured Brok. They are not travelling far, else Brok would be leading a group of guards, but Brok is large enough, competent enough and intimidating enough that they are considered to be adequate protection. Innis's family is wealthy and, though not noble, have the desire to enter it by marrying Innis well.

Indigaf Kolnar: Indigaf is a young priest who has just graduated from their seminary and is heading out to a distant village where they will replace the existing priest who is retiring. They have a level of enthusiasm for their faith that is only seen in the young. Indigaf isn't a fanatic, but they are a true believer and will attempt to engage anyone they meet in a religious discussion, often in the hopes of making a convert.

Jakka Din: Jakka is dressed like a competent sellsword, which is somewhat misleading. Though they are competent and do sell their services for money, they are actually an assassin. Jakka is looking for their current target, who left the characters' last port of call at about the same time. It's possible that one of the characters is Jakka's target; if not, there is a chance they might be mistaken for them.

One page is the front cover, one page the front matter and one page is ads.

The supplement is also available in a version for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. You do not need to buy both versions.

boardgame.name: Beyblade: V-Force – Ultimate Blader Jam
boardgame.description:
Players will control a member of a Beyblade group that is vying to be the world's best. Players will have the option of choosing from one of two possible Beyblades assigned to the player's character when challenged. Beyblades can be collected from defeating opponents and winning tournaments. When in battle, the player has two bars visible at the upper left hand corner of the screen. The green bar is the spin bar, which slowly depletes as time progresses. As the spin bar depletes, the player will have a harder time controlling their Beyblade. Players can increase their spin by moving over squares marked with a green symbol. Each Beyblade has an attack that, when charged, will release the Beyblades super attack. The attack bar is filled by knocking opponents off the map. Players can execute a regular attack only when close to their opponents. As players collect Beyblade parts, they can change their attack technique. At the beginning of each map the player must time their rip cord to determine the amount of spin that they will start with.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: 100 Individuals and Groups to Meet on the Road (PFRPG)
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

When characters are travelling between places on the roads and paths, there are going to be other travellers, groups and individuals, pedestrians and riders, on the routes as well. This supplement has 100 different travellers and groups that can enliven a journey. Some of the travellers are innocuous, some are interesting and some may be a potential threat. Others can be a potential source of adventure hooks. Small groups and individuals have all the travellers named; larger groups just the principal NPC.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are some sample results:

Ghoran Trelpor: Ghoran (drunkard, see the GameMastery Guide) staggers into view, swaying from side to side, barely able to remain upright. A jug dangles from one hand, now largely empty, for Ghoran is extremely drunk. They will "recognise" that characters as old friends and stumble across to them, offering a drink from their jug, spraying alcohol around as they do, vomit all over the feet of one of the characters than collapse and pass out on the road.

Gral Borchas: Gral (human expert 3) is the foreman of a group of six workers (human expert 1) who are currently repairing the road, both the current area and in other spots. They are filling in potholes and ruts but passing them can be difficult as they tend to block the road. They have a couple of wagons with them as well, pulled by sturdy horses, on which they have their tools and supplies needed to fix the route.

Hasta Tilna: Hasta is a rather emaciated-looking individual who wants to travel with others for protection. This is not true; they wish to travel with others because they are hungry. Hasta is a life-sucker in constant need of sustenance and, if travelling with others, will drain life energy from a traveller every night. Not enough to kill the traveller, but the victim will look weaker in the morning. The observant will notice that Hasta gets less emaciated as they travel with them. (Hasta is a human fighter 3 whose life-sucking ability will drain 1 Con every night from a target that fails a DC 10 Fort test; lost Con will be regained as normal.)

Hel Morn and Carda Barth: Hel and Carda (treat as guards, but armed with mwk crossbows instead of the guisarme and javelin, see the NPC Codex) are driving a wagon off recently harvested lumber that is being taken to the city. The lumber was treated and cut up at a sawmill near to where it was harvested, and is ready to be used in carpentry and building. Though the cargo doesn't look that valuable, and certainly weighs a lot, it is valuable enough that both Hel and Carda are armed with crossbows to discourage bandits. (The wagon is a heavy wagon and there are 3,500 lbs of wood worth 5 sp per lb.)

Honarth Turmick and Jalal Vusthan: Honarth and Jalal (both human commoner 1) are accompanied by almost every member of their village, with only those unable to do the journey staying at home. As is the tradition, a couple about to get married, as they are, are escorted by the other villagers in a procession to an ancient standing stone for luck, before heading back to the village temple to get married.

One page is the front cover, one the front matter, one and two thirds are ads and one the Open Game License.

The supplement is also available in a system neutral version. You do not need to buy both versions.

boardgame.name: 100 Encounters for a Dubious Starport
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:
This is a list of 100 different encounters characters can have or see at a starport. The starport in question is most likely to be one of the less salubrious ones. On the borderlands, located on sparsely inhabited planets or ones with poor reputations. The kind of ports where the ships are inadequately maintained and ask few questions about cargoes, local law enforcement is non-existent or corrupt and everyone is likely armed. These encounters can be used to flesh out such a port or be used as potential adventure hooks.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are some sample results:

An emergency vehicle howls past, heading for a distant part of the port.

An explosion is heard coming from the far side of the port, and bits of debris rain down over a wide area. Where the explosion came from, a badly-damaged freighter is now on fire.

An individual in expensive, yet tacky, clothing is leaving a ship, accompanied by two huge, armed people who would appear to be bodyguards.

An unidentifiable and corroded lump of machinery is decaying by the side of a pad.

At one edge of the port a laser cannon in a pit suddenly fires several test shots.

One page is the front cover, one page the front matter and half a page is ads.

boardgame.name: 100 Notes and Letters to Find in Miskatonic Country: Arkham
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

When searching in various places, including homes, desks and the pockets of corpses, characters may on occasion stumble across notes and letters that contain meaningful or important information. They may also find notes and letters that are not. This supplement contains 100 notes and letters that characters could find in Miskatonic Country, focusing in or about Arkham. They may be simple letters about appointments or musings, or perhaps clues towards something more sinister. Keepers can use them as background colour, misinformation or as potential adventure hooks.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are some sample results:

I've got what you want. Pop round when you're ready. Ernie.

It's in a P.O. Box at the Post Office, but I don't have any more details yet.

It's on North Garrison, but you can't just walk in if you've not been before.

Keep an eye on Potrello. I have information that suggests he's vulnerable.

Kroger's delivery is going to be on Wednesday morning. Keep an eye out for it

One page is the front cover and one the front matter.

boardgame.name: Formless Blob of Chthugga - A Troika! Background
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This is a new background for Troika! Numinous Edition, for creatures who have given up solid form.

boardgame.name: Alone in the Fantasy Mountains
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Alone in the Fantasy Mountains is a hack of Takuma Okada's Alone Among the Stars.

This is a journalling game requiring one player, a pack of 52 standard playing cards and a six-sided die (1d6) or another suitable randomiser.

You are a solo explorer of fantasy mountains, travelling through the uplands, encountering creatures and inhabitants, hazards, treasures and ruins of the world's mountainous regions. Perhaps you will find treasure; perhaps you will end your days crumpled at the bottom of a cliff.

boardgame.name: Azukail Games December 2020 Newsletter
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This newsletter has an update on the products releasing in December 2020.

These are:

100 Encounters for a Dubious Starport
100 Features of the Underearth Realms
100 Individuals and Groups to Meet on the Road
100 Individuals and Groups to Meet on the Road (PFRPG)
100 Modern Street Encounters (DS&DS)
100 Notes and Letters to Find in Lovecraft Country
100 Rumours to Hear in or About the Great Rift: Riftspan Reaches, Touchstone and Afawahisa
100 Sci-Fi Gangs
Six Pack: Christmas Spells (PFRPG)

boardgame.name: Shrapnel (Issue 1 - 2020)
boardgame.description:
Shrapnel: The Official Battletech Magazine
Issue 1
boardgame.rpg: A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Shrapnel (Issue 2 - 2020)
boardgame.description:
Shrapnel: The Official Battletech Magazine
Issue #2
boardgame.rpg: A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Pink Panther & Sons Race Game
boardgame.description: A colorful children's game akin to Candy Land, featuring the panther kids from the cartoon show Pink Panther & Sons from the 1980s. Players take turns moving their rainbow panther kid up the mountain by rolling the colored die and advancing to the corresponding space while trying to avoid the Howl Angel spaces that can send you back.

boardgame.name: Scrabble Sensor
boardgame.description: Predecessor to the Scrabble Lexor, Scrabble Sensor was touted as the hot new electronic word game to spice up game night or to bring Scrabble on the go. Gameplay is more like mastermind and hangman as opposed to traditional Scrabble play. Featuring solitaire, singles, doubles, and scoring variations of play. Players use the keyboard to enter and guess at hidden words through the console with the aid of lights and beeps to give hints.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Admin: Outside the Scope of BGG

boardgame.name: Steal This Election!
boardgame.description:
A political satire card game for two players. One game takes 15-225 minutes. Players collect, modify, and steal voter population cards from each other, using action cards based on popular conspiracy theories from the 2020 U.S. Presidential election, as well as conspiracy theories from other areas of pop culture.

Steal This Election! should be equally fun/offensive to game enthusiasts of any political persuasion.

Once all population cards are accounted for, the voting is over -- but not the election! If the loser refuses to concede, the game moves into a brief "Litigation and Recount" phase. More population cards are distributed, and more dirty tricks are played before a last count finally brings closure to the election.

boardgame.name: Netzgewitter
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb

Unerwartete Wettgewinne, merkwürdige Vorgänge im Untergrund, geplünderte Konten und gefährliche BTL-Chips: Berlin droht ein tödliches Gewitter. Und während sich die Wolken zusammenziehen, werden die Runner immer tiefer zwischen die Fronten bewaffneter Kieze, skrupelloser Konzernforscher, dissonanter Technomancer, wütender Vory und einem dunklen Geheimnis aus uralter Technik gezogen. Die Blitzeinschläge kommen näher. Deckung suchen ist keine Option mehr. Und während es um Moral, Gewinn und Überleben geht, kann vielleicht nur noch ein mysteriöser Verbündeter aus Code und Kristall helfen.

Netzgewitter ist ein Kampagnenband für Shadowrun 6, der im Megasprawl an der Spree spielt. In mehreren Kapiteln durchleben die Runner eine spannende Story um alte Verbindungen und neuen Hass, die eng mit dem Metaplot der ADL verknüpft ist. Netzgewitter ist eine deutsche Eigenproduktion und bietet fertige Abenteuer in einer zum Teil modular aufgebauten Handlung. Und an deren Ende wartet ein fulminanter Showdown, der nicht nur über das Schicksal der Runner entscheiden wird.

boardgame.name: Space Opera
boardgame.description:
"Space Opera" is a game of galactic politics for 2 to 4 players. Each player controls a different power bloc striving to come out on top of the new order. Game play is character-driven and the exploits of a handful of a few, key citizens will determine the fate of the galaxy for the next several centuries.

Your goal is to bring the majority of planetary governments under the control of your power bloc. Your tools include recruitment, local elections, diplomacy, and the occasional coup d'état and assassination.

Players take turns activating one of their bloc’s citizens. When activated, a citizen may take 2 different actions; draw a new planet, replace an unpopular government, draw or play opportunity cards, recruit a population or new citizen, and travel.

Dice are rolled to determine the degree of success (if any) of each action. The number of dice rolled depends on your citizen’s requisite skill level. Skills are guile, intelligence, negotiation, opportunity, rank, and wealth.

You can push your luck by re-rolling some of the dice, but failure on a re-roll can lead to failure and injury.

Certain dramatic events, such as an assassination or successful no-confidence vote, ratchet up the tension. This is indicated by removing a clock token from a pool.

Once the pool is empty the game ends and the power bloc that controls the most planetary governments wins!

—description from the designer
