boardgame.name: Le Jeu de la chouette: Connaissez-vous Dijon ?
boardgame.description:
Le Jeu de la chouette (The game of the Owl) is a mix between Trivial Pursuit and the Goose Game.

300 questions to (re)discover Dijon and its history…
Le Jeu de la chouette is conceived as a walk in the city center of Dijon.
To win, correctly answer questions on:

history,
heritage,
gastronomy,
famous people,
arts and literature,
sport.


For each question, a detailed answer lets you to learn while having fun.
Conquer the 6 large city squares on the board!

The Owl is Dijon mascot.

boardgame.name: Retro Bowl
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Retro Bowl is a throwback to the arcade football game of the 80's. Players manage an American football team through the seasons, drafting new players, picking up free agents, and hiring new staffs. Players have to manage the players, their health, their salaries, and their egos. On the field, the players control the offensive side of the team during a top down arcade style control of the player with the ball.

boardgame.name: Cities Sourcebook: London - Manhattan - Tokyo
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Explore the megacities of London, Manhattan, and Tokyo.

From the introduction:

In the City of London the English language has developed over hundreds of years, and there is a resurgence of old slang as well as brand new slang words. This is just a short list of slang to add flavor to any London campaign.

boardgame.name: Interlinked
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Interlinked is a series of scenarios designed for players who have a few missions under their belts and are familiar with the setting and rules. It is recommended to play this adventure after roadblock as there are a number of combat and social situations that will be especially challenging. A couple of missteps and the body count will quickly grow.

boardgame.name: Carbon 2185 Quickstart Guide
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the Carbon 2185 Quickstart Guide. This PDF contains everything that you need to play Carbon 2185 at it’s most basic form.

If you haven’t played Carbon 2185 before, or any other tabletop roleplaying games, you will have no trouble using this PDF to create, or play stories and adventures in the dystopian 2185 universe. We’ve designed this quickstart with ease of use at the front of our minds, and we give detailed explanations and instructions throughout, so that even the newest of players and Game Masters can enjoy it.

Gather your friends, family, club members, or even random people from an online group finding website, and step inside.

boardgame.name: The Unhackable (Level 1)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to The Unhackable, a Fragmented Legacy mission designed for three to six cyberpunks. Each Fragmented Legacy mission will be available for two different level parties.

This scenario is the level 1 version of The Unhackable.

boardgame.name: Rap Battles Of Rhymania
boardgame.description:
Drop the beat and get ready to throw down the best rhymes you can create in this fast-paced card game where only one rapper can come out on top—because here in Rhymania, every dispute is settled with a rap battle!

At the beginning of each round, each player draws 5 cards. Then, they are able to discard and redraw as many cards as they want. Then, by strategically matching cards with rhymes ending in the same sound, they deal damage to their opponent.

Slightly asymmetric characters (rappers) provide abilities that can be used at various times throughout the round.

Continue playing rounds until one player is dealt 20 points of damage, this player is the loser.

boardgame.name: The Blue Dragon Lair
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Blue Dragon Lair is an...encounter for four characters of 5th, 11th, or 20th level. This encounter is setting and adventure independent.

boardgame.name: The Forgotten Library
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This adventure can be dropped on the adventurers at any point in time when they are at level 3. The hook is straightforward.

As the party walks along the road, a letter materializes at the feet of one of the players. This letter can contain any number of backstory motivations. Perhaps it details the incarceration of a loved one, or perhaps the location of a powerful item someone is looking for.

Upon opening the letter, as the character reads it, the world starts to shift around the party, as the letters in the letter start making less and less sense. The adventurers find themselves on a snowy road.

boardgame.name: The Great Heist
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

While the party is out and about, either in a tavern or simply travelling, they will be approached by Myles Mittens, a tabaxi thief with black fur and jittery demeanor. He asks them pointblank if they are adventurers. If they reply affirmatively, he'll say he has a business proposal. And he intends to pay handsomely.
